definition: to go round a curve/to turn a corner/fig. a new direction
to turn (a corner etc)/to kidnap/to swindle/to misappropriate/walking stick/crutch/seven (used as a substitute for 七[qi1])
to bend/bent/a bend/a turn (in the road etc)/CL:道[dao4]
lit. going round the curves and skirting the corners (idiom)/fig. to speak in a roundabout way/to equivocate/to beat about the bush
winding and turning (idiom)
erhua variant of 拐彎|拐弯[guai3 wan1]
corner/bend

sentences.english: Stop defeusinging regarding the bush. Will you quit or not?
sentences.chinese: 别拐弯儿抹角了，你到底戒不戒烟？

sentences.english: Don't forget to indicate before turning.
sentences.chinese: 拐弯之前别忘记指示车行方向。

sentences.english: By his own account the car was coming too fast round the bend.
sentences.chinese: 根据他本人的说法，那辆汽车拐弯时开得太快。
别拐弯儿抹角了，你到底戒不戒烟？

sentences.english: With its twists and turns, Lombard Street is known as the most crooked in the world.
sentences.chinese: 曲折拐弯的隆巴德街恐怕是世界上最弯曲的街道了。

sentences.english: What was it that made you zigzag all over Paris like a hunted deer?
sentences.chinese: 又是什么使你曲里拐弯各地巴黎像猎杀鹿？

sentences.english: Take the first turning on [to] the left.
sentences.chinese: 在第一个拐弯处向左拐。

sentences.english: Bear left at the traffic light.
Americans talk like their poems, as soon as possible into the topic, won't beat around the bush.
sentences.chinese: 美国人说话喜欢直抒胸臆，尽快入题，不会拐弯抹角。

sentences.english: There is a telephone box on the comer.
sentences.chinese: 在拐弯处有一个电话间。

sentences.english: And he advanced on the tips of his boots towards the corner which Marius had turned.
sentences.chinese: 他踮起长统靴的脚尖朝着马吕斯拐弯的那个墙角走去。

sentences.english: Don't beat the bushes ,tell me what the earth happened.
sentences.chinese: 别拐弯抹角地解释了，告诉我究竟发生了什么。

sentences.english: Take the first turning on the right.
sentences.chinese: 在第一个拐弯处往右拐。

sentences.english: The road to the zoo turns off here.
sentences.chinese: 通向动物园的路由这儿拐弯。

sentences.english: The car side slipped as it rounded the curve.
sentences.chinese: 车子拐弯时向侧面滑去。

sentences.english: Or it burrowed through the problem by some circuitous loophole of logic.
sentences.chinese: 或者通过某种拐弯抹角的逻辑漏洞草草掠过问题。

definition: to turn/to go around a corner
corner/bend
erhua variant of 拐彎|拐弯[guai3 wan1]
to make a sudden turn
winding road/road curve
downhill
uphill/upslope/to move upwards/to climb a slope
to bend/bent/a bend/a turn (in the road etc)/CL:道[dao4]
to turn left
to turn right
to go straight/straight forward/fig. to do right
(of two vehicles traveling in opposite directions) to pass by each other
emergency braking
to overtake (another car)
to change lanes
to reduce speed/to slow down/to take it easy
